system.biography:
TitleFFF 706-1 Shek Pvar Savorya
Birthday13 Nolus 671
AppearanceAge 48, height 5’ 1”, scant frame, weight 102 lb, average appearance, medium complexion, black/grey hair, hazel eyes
Medical/PsycheNone
Size4
ArmorSoft leather calf boots, cloth leggings, robe and cap. Dagger.
Other Equipment
Valuables£1 in gold, 408d in silver in a money pouch
NotesOther Spells: As desired by GM.

Biography

Esoteric Items: Level 2, 15 pt. Neutral Focus. Level 5, 27 pt. Savoryan Focus. Sanctum, tower workroom is a + 36 Savoryan sanctum

Born to a wealthy family in Karejia, Shansea is used to a life of privilege. Her family’s connections earned her an apprenticeship at the Helas Chantry. She excelled at her studies, completing her apprenticeship in six years. Despite her desire for a life of research, her family arranged a marriage to the only son of a neighbouring landowner. Tragically, her husband died less than a year after the marriage, leaving her a prosperous estate and an infant daughter. With her income assured, she settled in for a life of research, returning to her chantry periodically. Within a few years she had earned the rank of Sheneva.

Shansea then began studying the workings of the human brain, something she found particularly intriguing. Her experiments used the estate staff and residents as unknowing, and unwilling, subjects. There were a number of unfortunate incidents that attracted the unwelcome and dangerous attention of the White Hand. In 708, she was declared renegade and forced to flee for her life. To cover her escape she set fire to the manor house, killing several servants and leaving sufficient evidence to make the White Hand believe she and her daughter had perished.

Shansea and her daughter fled north, eventually reaching Harling in Ibanvaal. There, she encountered the Order of the Crimson Dancer. Shansea found she had much in common with the Agrikans and came to a mutually beneficial arrangement. The Crimson Dancers arranged transportation to Orbaal and, in 715, rebuilt an old hunting lodge in the mountains for her research. They provide her with a generous stipend and a steady supply of research subjects. In return, Shansea has happily broadened her research to include the study of conditioning and behavior modification requested by the Agrikans.

Adventure Hooks

The Long Arm of the White Hand: The PCs are hired by an agent of the Shek P’var to travel to Orbaal and investigate the rumour of a witch living near Quimen and aiding the Crimson Dancers. They are to gather information and report back.

They took my daughter: The Crimson Dancers have kidnapped a young woman to be one of Shansea’s subjects. The PCs have to get her back before she is altered forever.

Unwitting Pawns: Shansea has stirred from her tower to access some records in a Save K’nor temple. The PCs are compelled to provide a distraction for her while she raids the library. Once she is gone, the compulsion fades. The PCs are now wanted fugitives and must bring the real culprit to justice to clear their names.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
